actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 20, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Newhouse moved that the House do now adjourn.

Pursuant to clause 11 of rule 10, clause 11 of rule 1, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence: Mr. Crawford (Chair), Mr. Kelly of Mississippi, Mr. LaHood, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia, Mr. Hill of Arkansas, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Perry, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Cline, Mr. Steube, Ms. Tenney and Mr. Fallon.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on January 16, 2025, at 2:30 p.m.: Appointments: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission).
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification of the issuance of an Executive Order that takes additional steps to deal with the national emergency declared in Executive Order 13694 of April 1, 2015 (Blocking the Property of Certain Persons Engaging in Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities), as amended by Executive Order 13757 of December 28, 2016 and Executive Order 13984 of January 19, 2021
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-13).
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Mr. Babin asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Thursday, January 16, 2025, it adjourn to meet at 10:00 a.m. on Monday, January 20, 2025 Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 274
actions-list.actionItem: 145 (Roll no. 17).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 206
actions-list.actionItem: 213 (Roll no. 16).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Moore (WI) moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 30.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 5. H.R. 30 â€” "To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that aliens who have been convicted of or who have committed sex offenses or domestic violence are inadmissible and deportable."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
